page.title: 18RESERVOIR and ABBATOIR 52/29
page.content:
{BRYNSWORTHY RESERVOIR. }Behind the Brynsworthy Nurseries is a small reservoir known as the Brysnworthy Reservoir and is under the auspices of the South West Water Authority. It is of course fenced off and inaccessible, only being used as a resource for the immediate area.
{THE ABATTOIR. }Until a few months ago, early in 1985, this Abattoir was open to anyone wanting their animals slaughtered for meat purposes. Now in July it is closed temporarily to any use. Animals for slaughter, have to be taken to the Abattoir in Torrington. The workers who live in the three modern bungalows in close vicinity now work in the Torrington meat factory travelling there each day.
